intro: Lysimachia rapensis, commonly known as the Chinese chickweed or water sorrel, is a flowering plant native to East Asia. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically reaches heights of 10–30 cm. The plant features small, lance-shaped leaves and yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as stream banks and forest floors. Lysimachia rapensis is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
